intro: Aspidoglossum angustissimum subsp. angustissimum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved aspidoglossum, is a member of the Asparagaceae family. It is a flowering plant native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant features strap-shaped, narrow leaves that are typically green with a slight blue or grayish tinge. It produces small, white or pale green flowers in clusters during the summer months. This species is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
